extendedIngredients.name: new potatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 2 pounds small new potatoes, wiped clean

extendedIngredients.name: taleggio
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 pound Taleggio or other mild semisoft cheese, thinly sliced
extendedIngredients.originalName: Taleggio or other mild semisoft cheese, thinly sliced

title: Warm New Potato Salad with Taleggio and Arugula
summary: Warm New Potato Salad with Taleggio and Arugula might be just the side dish you are searching for. This gluten free and fodmap friendly recipe serves 4 and costs $5.49 per serving. One portion of this dish contains around 17g of protein, 22g of fat, and a total of 420 calories. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. If you have arugula, pepper, olive oil, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It will be a hit at your The Fourth Of July event. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 25 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 72%, this dish is solid. Try Warm Potato Salad with Arugula, Warm Potato Salad with Halibut and Arugula, and Gnocchi With Arugula, Morels, and Taleggio for similar recipes.
instructions: In a large saucepan, cover the potatoes with cold water, set a lid on top and bring to a boil. Add salt, reduce the heat to low and simmer until the potatoes are tender, 12 to 15 minutes; drain.                                              Preheat the broiler. In a large bowl, toss the arugula with the olive oil. Transfer to a large ovenproof platter. Cut the potatoes in half and arrange on the arugula in a single layer. Top with the Taleggio cheese and season with salt and pepper. Broil for about 1 minute, or until the cheese melts, and serve.

steps.step: In a large saucepan, cover the potatoes with cold water, set a lid on top and bring to a boil.
Add salt, reduce the heat to low and simmer until the potatoes are tender, 12 to 15 minutes; drain.
Preheat the broiler. In a large bowl, toss the arugula with the olive oil.
Transfer to a large ovenproof platter.
Cut the potatoes in half and arrange on the arugula in a single layer. Top with the Taleggio cheese and season with salt and pepper. Broil for about 1 minute, or until the cheese melts, and serve.
